36.title: "Code Red in the New Comicdom"
36.author: James Adams
36.appears_in: p. R1, R9 in The Globe and Mail (Toronto, Ont.), May 2, 2002.
notes: "The comic-book industry has been trying to woo a wider audience, and better sales, with more explicit storylines. Now, publishers are hoping Spider-Man can spin them some attention."
Article on the Comics Code, quoting Stan Lee, Heidi Koenig, Joe Quesada, and John Miller, and mentioning Free Comic Book Day and the movie Spider-Man.

58.heading: Codes.
58.title: "Branding Time"
58.author: [No author]
58.series: Cactus Canyon) p. 10-14 in Treasure Chest of Fun & Fact, v. 4, no. 6
notes: Begins: "Betsy Bell and her grandfather have found a temporary home on Cactus Canyon Ranch. When Loko, a bucking broncho, threw Betsy she had to spend six weeks in a wheel chair. To interest her, Uncle Mack, owner of the ranch, told her the story of Injun Joe's buried treasure. The Indian, as he lay dying, babbled something about burying a box containing treasure. He gave Uncle Mack a key and a faded code and map to the secret place."

59.heading: Codes.
59.title: "Burying the Treasure"
59.author: [No author]
59.series: Cactus Canyon) p. 30-34 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 4, no. 9
notes: Begins: "When her treasure code was accidentally devoured by a hungry billy goat, Betsy Bell was brokenhearted. She thought it lost forever until, to her surprise, she found a copy which had been hidden away by one of the ranch cowboys! Puzzled as to what she should do about it, she rode at once to the mission for a talk with her good friend, Father Valentine."

66.heading: Codes.
66.title: "Must All My Wimmen Keep Pekinese?"
66.author: art: Rafael Astarita (as John Martin)
notes: Summary: Both Peaches and enemy agent Marie White own Pekinese dogs. Hooks is in Hawaii trying to stop the smuggling of Japanese soldiers onto the island. He's captured by the enemy, and headquarters gets a cable for him from Peaches about her puppies not being Pekinese. Headquarters assumes it must be coded, finds Marie's dog, and investigates. Hook is freed and the mission is a success.
Data from Gene Reed via Grand Comic Book Database.

69.heading: Codes.
69.title: "Rodeo, Here I Come!"
69.author: by Dixie Willson
69.appears_in: p. 11-15 in Treasure Chest of Fun and Fact, v. 4, no. 7 (Nov. 30, 1948).
notes: Begins: "Betsy Bell and her grandfather have found a temporary home on Cactus Canyon Ranch. When Loko, a bucking broncho, threw Betsy, she had to spend six weeks in a wheelchair. To interest her, Uncle Mack, owner of the ranch, told her a story of Injun Joe's buried treasure. Uncle Mack has a key and a faded code and map. Betsy decided to try to find the treasure so that she could get enough money for a home for herself and Grampy. Before she could start to hunt, the map was eaten by Pooky, the goat, so Betsy decided to win the money in the summer rodeo."

120.title: "Cody Starbuck"
120.author: by Howard Chaykin
120.appears_in: p. 48-59 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 2 (May 1981).

121.title: "Cody Starbuck"
121.author: by Howard Chaykin
121.appears_in: p. 82-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 3 (June 1981).
notes: "Last we saw, Cody Starbuck and his crew, employed by Prometheus, continued their age-old expensive battle against Dax's research into hyperspace. After their victorious attack upon the Dax Corporation, Cody and his cohorts were pursued by the enemy interceptors."

122.title: "Cody Starbuck"
122.author: by Howard Chaykin
122.appears_in: p. 82-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 4 (July 1981).
notes: "When last we read, Cody and Porfirio had set out to meet with Lady Tessa in order to sell her a clonedroid labor force for Detweiler. When the three of them met, she furiously ordered that Cody and Porfirio be imprisoned, tried, and executed for no apparent reason."

123.title: "Cody Starbuck"
123.author: by Howard Chaykin
123.appears_in: p. 82-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 5 (Aug. 1981).
notes: "Last time: Cody rescued the fiercely ungrateful Lady Tessa from barbarian attackers. Her hostility toward him was based on her earlier encounter with his evil look-alike. Cody resolved then to track down this doppelganger. On the planet 1026 he found him!"

124.title: "Cody Starbuck"
124.author: by Howard V
124.appears_in: Chaykin. p. 34-43 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 6 (Sept. 1981).
notes: "When we left Cody, last issue, he had killed his Prometheus-manufactured clone and was off to avenge this too-close-for-comfort deception. While on his mission, he learnt of the death of his true love, Lady Tessa. She had been executed by Lady Rowena while he was on the planet 1026."

189.title: "Coeur Battant, Mandy ouvrit la Porte de la Cabane"
189.author: [No author]
189.series: Solitaire) p. 14-17 in Le Journal de Nano et Nanette, no. 191
notes: "Résumé: Un poulain du Wyoming a perdu sa mère, tombée dans un précipice et il est demeuré seul au monde. Il a été secouru par Mandy Morgan, une orpheline vivant chez son oncle Matt, qui est méchant pour elle. La jeune fille est allée chercher du lait pour nourrir le petit animal mourant de faim."

191.author: [No author]
191.series: Solitaire) p. 14-15 in Le Journal de Nano et Nanette, no. 202
notes: "Résumé: Avec son cher cheval 'Solitaire', Mandy Morgan s'est enfuie de chez son oncle qui voulait l'envoyer dans un orphelinat. En poursuivant la jeune fille, soupçonnée de vol, Nag Quigley, le sheriff, a tiré sur Solitaire."

196.heading: Le Coeur Couronné. English.
196.title: Madwoman of the Sacred Heart
196.author: story by Alexandro Jodorowsky; art by Jean "Moebius" Giraud ; letters by Dave Cooper ; translated by Randy and Jean-Marc Lofficier.
notes: Translation of: Le Coeur Couronné 1: La Folie du Sacre-Coeur.

Summary: "In a world of narco-terrorism, fifty-second soundbites, and multi-national corporations, how would we deal with a new Savior? Would we, like the Romans, even be aware of the birth of a new Messiah? Could we tell the difference between John the Baptist and just another sect of nuts?"
